title: Health Care Down Slightly As Traders Hedge On Regulatory Outlook — Health Care Roundup
text:
Health-care companies fell slightly as traders hedged their bets on the likelihood of regulation in the sector.

Shares of Vivus rose after one of its obesity-related treatments received approval in a handful of northern European countries.

Questions remain for the commercialization of Novartis' Zolgensma in a new indication for the treatment of muscular dystrophy, according to analysts at Swiss bank UBS, as reported earlier.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 07, 2019 16:46 ET (20:46 GMT)
